channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Hooray, it's a stamp duty holiday! Rishi Sunak's tax cut will give flagging homes market a boost
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak is set to axe stamp duty on most homes on Wednesday in a temporary move designed to boost the flagging housing market and which could save buyers thousands.

item.title: Police to be told to prosecute shoplifters stealing under £200
item.description: The news comes as it was suggested supermarkets and convenience stores may be resorting to private prosecutions to pursue thefts after complaints they are being ignored by police.

item.title: England and West Indies will take a knee before first Test to show support for Black Lives Matter
item.description: EXCLUSIVE BY RICHARD GIBSON: England and West Indies players will take a knee together in support of the Black Lives Matter movement ahead of Wednesday's first Test.

item.title: Circuses deliver a letter to Downing Street saying they have 'two weeks before the end of the road'
item.description: More than 50 performers from some of the UK's top circuses made Downing Street resemble a Big Top on Tuesday as they delivered a letter to Boris Johnson calling for urgent action.

item.title: SARAH VINE: Attacking 'Karens' is just racism by another name
item.description: SARAH VINE: Until last week, if you had asked the BBC to nominate the most reviled species on the planet, the answer would have been obvious: middle-aged white men, of course. Now it's a 'Karen'.

item.title: Artist exhibits stunning collection of million-knotted collages of Russian Orthodox icons
item.description: Vladimir Denshchikov's Orthodox icons were put on display at the Simferopol Art Museum in the Crimea on Tuesday.

item.title: Nick Carter says armed forces must stamp out 'laddish culture'
item.description: General Sir Nick Carter, the Chief of the Defence Staff, said such culture needed stamping out and it was 'simply unacceptable' that they had so far failed to 'move the dial' on the issue.

item.title: Horrifying moment teen's extravagant pool dive goes wrong
item.description: Ashley Hepler, 18, posted the footage of her failed stunt to Instagram on Sunday, before it was shared by a slew of celebrities.

item.title: Starbucks employee allegedly wrote 'ISIS' on Muslim woman's beverage
item.description: Minnesota woman Aishah, 19, says a Starbucks barista wrote 'ISIS' on her beverage at a St. Paul, Minnesota location on July 1, leaving her horrified and enraged.

item.title: Travellers invade Prince Charles' 'designer village' of Poundbury
item.description: A large dump truck was seen offloading what appeared to be garden waste in Poundbury - the Prince of Wales' estate - sparking fears it is being used as a dumping ground.

item.title: Actress Nadia Sawalha made a bold bid to break the ultimate body taboo by showing her cellulite
item.description: Actress and Loose Women regular Nadia Sawalha's phone has been ringing and pinging incessantly this week, with friends, colleagues and social media followers saluting her bravery.

item.title: Instagram allows all users to pin comments at top of posts in effort to moderate abusive replies
item.description: The feature is being introduced across the world after a test in May and lets users pin three comments to their posts which will appear at the top of each comment thread

item.title: Leviathans of the British establishment are labelled China's 'useful idiots'
item.description: The British individuals gathered up by the telecoms giant to work for the company could not be of higher calibre (pictured: the Queen and Sir Kenneth Olisa, who sits on the Huawei UK board).

item.title: A generation of women betrayed: Thousands were harmed by THREE health scandals
item.description: The inquiry said lives were 'catastrophically affected' by mistakes made with the three products and criticised the NHS, private health firms and regulators (pictured: campaigner Kath Sansom).

item.title: Government could pay 300,000 young people in Rishi Sunak's £2bn plan to prevent unemployment rise
item.description: Wednesday's mini-Budget will see Chancellor Rishi Sunak put jobs at the heart of his £2billion scheme to prevent a surge in youth unemployment, and reveal how Britain will boost the economy.

item.title: Hunspach in Alsace is the winner of the most beautiful village in France competition
item.description: A chocolate-box village known for its historical houses has been named the most beautiful in France for 2020. It has scooped the top prize in The Favourite Village of the French TV contest.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'smashes up kitchen and throws wine bottle to the floor in drunken rage at Amber Heard'
item.description: The video, shown on the first day of Johnny Depp's libel case against the Sun, shows the pair appearing to argue in the kitchen while an agitated-looking Depp repeatedly slams cupboard doors.

item.title: Donald Trump calls flying Confederate flag 'freedom of speech'
item.description: President Donald Trump said the decision to fly the Confederate flag is one of 'freedom of speech' after lashing out at NASCAR for banning it from its racing events.

item.title: Trump says he didn't cheat his SAT and says father was 'loving'
item.description: The White House released a statement on Tuesday claiming President Donald Trump asserts he did not cheat on his SATs like his niece claimed in her upcoming book.

item.title: Donald Trump suffered 'child abuse' at the hands of his father, his niece claims in book
item.description: Mary Trump, Donald Trump's niece, will claim in her bombshell memoir he suffered 'child abuse' at the hands of his workaholic father Fred Trump Sr. The book will be released on July 14.

item.title: UK Sport launch probe into claims that British gymnasts were abused by their coaches
item.description: RIATH AL-SAMARRAI: British Gymnastics confirmed that there will also be an independent inquiry into the mistreatment of athletes, after a series of astonishing claims.

item.title: Exeter Chiefs to review branding after protests from fans over use of Native American imagery
item.description: CHRIS FOY: The Devon club have faced a growing clamour to change their Chiefs imagery - but not the nickname itself - after a petition was launched by a group of supporters.

item.title: Twins born in London and who have never left the UK are facing deportation to different countries
item.description: Darrell Roberts, 24, has been issued a deportation notice by the Home Office. Meanwhile his twin brother Darren has been told by prison staff he will likely be dispatched to Grenada.

item.title: Folding iPhone patent suggests design with offset hinge
item.description: What makes this particular patent interesting beyond the fact that one of the biggest smart phone purveyors in the world may potentially enter into the folding phone market, is its unique form factor.

item.title: Congress told of US withdrawal from World Health Organization
item.description: The Trump Administration has formally told Congress that the U.S. is withdrawing from the World Health Organization, which is helping oversee the global response to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Air filter can 'catch and kill' the coronavirus instantly at 392F
item.description: An air filter that can 'catch and kill' the coronavirus could help limit the spread of the deadly disease. The The device uses nickel foam that traps SARS-CoV-2 and heats it to 392 degrees Fahrenheit

item.title: Germany plans to shut all coal-burning power plants by 2038
item.description: The German government has approved a new set of bills that will transition the country's energy infrastructure toward renewable sources and close its last coal power plant in 2038.

item.title: Roald Dahl's grandson Ned marries Princess Raiyah of Jordan
item.description: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Journalist Ned Donovan and his bride, Princess Raiyah of Jordan, have married here in England with almost no one present....

item.title: Apple and T-Mobile sued for security flaw that allowed strangers to access iMessages, FaceTime calls
item.description: The lawsuit filed on Monday in the US District Court for the Southern District of New York accuses Apple and T-Mobile of jeopardizing consumer privacy by failing to disclose the flaw.

item.title: Coronavirus Europe: Death rate two thirds up on bad flu year
item.description: Spain had the worst mortality rate across all ages at the height of the pandemic in early April, followed by England a week later.Excess deaths in the 45-65 cohort peaked in mid-April in England.

item.title: Kasabian ordered Tom Meighan to quit after assault of partner
item.description: Band members of Kasabian have today revealed they ordered lead singer Tom Meighan to quit. He today appeared at Leicester Magistrates' Court to admit to attacking his fiancee.

item.title: Furious care bosses demand Boris Johnson retracts his 'cowardly' comments
item.description: The Independent Care Group described the comments as a 'real slap in the face' and the Community Integrated Care charity said his words were 'clumsy and cowardly'.

item.title: Heartwarming moment girl gets to hug her dad after he isolated for 3 months at the care home he owns
item.description: Christopher Dando had a heart warming reunion with his family three months after going into isolation with residents and staff at Court House Retirement Home in Cheddar, Somerset.

item.title: Johnny Depp divorced Amber Heard when she defecated in bed
item.description: The 34-year-old, who was wearing a red polka dot scarf over her face, approached London's High Court court hand in hand with her sister, Whitney, and lawyer, Jennifer Robinson.

item.title: Victim names Donald Trump as possible Jeffrey Epstein witness
item.description: An unnamed woman is suing Jeffrey Epstein's estate and claims that he took her to Mar-a-Lago when she was 14 and was showed to Donald Trump.

item.title: ANDREW PIERCE: The final shame of violent ex-major who bragged: 'You can't touch me, I'm an MP'
item.description: ANDREW PIERCE: The Strangers' Bar in the Commons has witnessed its fair share of 'incidents'. But what took place one February night in 2012 involved a level of violence not seen before.

item.title: Climate change and melting ice caps may cause huge Arctic waves
item.description: Extreme waves could become catastrophic in the Arctic that occur every two to five years as a result of climate change, a new study finds. Experts also say some waves could reach heights over 19 feet.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'had tried every drug known to man' by age 14
item.description: The Pirates of the Caribbean actor, 58, was speaking during the first day of an explosive libel trial in London involving his estranged wife Amber Heard in which he denied ever hitting her.

item.title: The £4bn cost of shut schools: Parents struggle to cope with childcare
item.description: Families are losing an average of £36 per week from their household income as they struggle to cope with increased childcare demands, while some parents are losing in excess of £300.

item.title: ASK TONY: When my husband died Barclays added to my distress
item.description: Following the sudden death of my husband, Barclays has been by far the worst and most unsympathetic company I have had to deal with. We had an interest-free loan in my late husband's name.

item.title: Broken vows: Lockdown misery for couples who still want a big wedding
item.description: Nearly 75,000 weddings were cancelled in England between the beginning of lockdown on March 23 and July 3. Some venues have been caught pocketing thousands of pounds in deposits.

item.title: Ruben Loftus-Cheek accuses neighbours of 'borderline racism'
item.description: Ruben Loftus-Cheek claimed 'no rules had been broken' by building the decking in the garden of his £1.7 million home in Cobham, Surrey, without planning permission.

item.title: Gillian Taylforth's ex survived a shooting when gun 'misfired'
item.description: Dave Fairbairn, 64, revealed to a friend that the bullet - which missed his vital organs - fired before he heard 'lots of clicking' during the incident in Enfield, North London.

item.title: Case of HIV patient in remission raises hope
item.description: A 34-year-old male from Brazil with HIV has gone into long-term remission after treatment with drugs alone, boosting hope of a cure for millions living with the virus.

item.title: Man, 19, is charged with murder of 'brilliant' jazz trumpeter, 53
item.description: The head and torso of William Algar, 53, was discovered in Barnes, London, on January 3. His arms and legs had been removed. Emeka Dawuda-Wodu, 19, has been charged with his murder.

item.title: Video shows Cornelius Fredericks being restrained before death
item.description: The footage released on Tuesday shows the moment 16-year-old Cornelius Fredericks was pushed to the floor and pinned down by staffers at the Lakeside Academy in Kalamazoo on April 29.

item.title: Sand artist who created giant masterpieces in Britain dies of heart attack while swimming in sea
item.description: Marc Treanor, a sand artist from Wales who created several pieces of large artwork on beaches, died after suffering a heart attack in the sea near a beach he loved in Cornwall last week.

item.title: The ultimate summer garment to bring out your inner GODDESS
item.description: From beach cover-up to dinner date, kaftans are the heroes of effortless summer style.Want to bring out your inner Goddess? Get to know Sai Sankoh, Asa Soltan and Camilla Franks.

item.title: Serial rape suspect charged with 2009 murder of one of victims
item.description: Aman Vyas, 35, turned a small area near his home in Walthamstow, east London, into his 'hunting ground' for a 'series of violent rapes' between March and May 2009, a court heard.

item.title: Usain Bolt shares FIRST pictures of his newborn daughter
item.description: The Olympic gold medallist, 33, took to Twitter on Tuesday to wish his partner Kasi Bennett, now 31, a happy birthday as they begin a new chapter of their lives together.

item.title: Mystery behind death of Worthing boy, 1, found dead in hot tub
item.description: The youngster, identified as Eddie Murphy-Boxall by his mother Siobhan Murphy, was found dead in a hot-tub in the back garden of his family's seaside home last month.

item.title: Coronavirus US: Cases rise in 40 states though death rate falls
item.description: Coronavirus infections are now on the rise in 40 states across the US as Sunbelt states like Texas, Arizona and California continue to report record hospitalizations and cases.

item.title: UK to resume arms sales to Saudi Arabia despite Yemen fears
item.description: International Trade Secretary Liz Truss said a fresh analysis of alleged violations of international humanitarian law (IHL) involving Saudi air strikes in Yemen concluded breaches were 'isolated'.

item.title: Johnny Depp says he gave daughter Lily-Rose marijuana at 13
item.description: Johnny Depp has revealed he gave daughter Lily-Rose marijuana when she was just 13 years old, claiming it was 'responsible parenting'.

item.title: Johnny Depp shares photo of finger severed by vodka bottle
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT Johnny Depp, 57, is suing The Sun for labeling him a 'wife beater'. Depp said Amber Heard allegedly threw a vodka bottle at him and severed his finger.

item.title: Royal enthusiast reveals how she has spent $30,000 on outfits
item.description: Danielle Magness-Wellmann, 41, from Hanska, Minnesota, has spent $30,000 (£24,000) on copying royal outfits after 'falling in love' with Kate Middleton's, 38, style in 2011.

item.title: Porn star Ryan Madison accused of sexual abuse by 10 co-stars
item.description: Madison, a porn veteran, runs Kelly Madison Productions, with his wife Kelly, main. On Tuesday it was claimed he is a 'serial abuser' who 'groomed' women. Accuser Jane Wilde is inset.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell in coronavirus isolation at Brooklyn jail
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell will spend 14 days in isolation at the Brooklyn jail described as a hell hole by the ex-warden.

item.title: Woman, 33, diagnosed with rare cancer after giving birth
item.description: Lucy Gray, now 33, from xx, has spoken of the moment she thought she was going to die after being told that she had a rare type of cancer after giving birth to her daughter.

item.title: Spitfire and Hurricane flypast for Dame Vera Lynn's funeral
item.description: Dame Vera Lynn, who entertained troops during the Second World War, died on June 18. Her passing will be marked with a private funeral with a flypast by the Battle of Britain Memorial Flight.

item.title: Westminster Abbey to reopen after longest closure since 1953
item.description: It will initially be open to visitors on Saturdays and Wednesday evenings, with a limited number of timed-entry tickets available solely through advance booking online.

item.title: Ryan Giggs STILL can't sell his £3.5m countryside home
item.description: The Manchester United legend, 46, put the five-bedroom former family home in Worlsey, Greater Manchester up for sale in January 2019.

item.title: Gwyneth Paltrow details her lockdown wellness routine
item.description: Gwyneth has shared the recipes, daily workouts, and wellness practices that have helped her adjust to life at home amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Dutch police discover torture chamber
item.description: Officers were investigating the criminal drug trade when they found the torture room and a make-shift prison in a warehouse in Wouwse Plantage, a small village in the southwestern Netherlands.
item.media:description: In this grab taken from video made available by the Netherlands Police on Tuesday, July 7, 2020, a view of a sea container equipped as a torture chamber, in Wouwse Plantage, Netherlands. Dutch police say they have arrested six men after discovering sea containers that had been converted into a makeshift prison and sound-proofed "torture chamber" complete with a dentist's chair, tools including pliers and scalpels and handcuffs. (Netherlands Police via AP)

item.title: New York cop kneels on black man's neck until he passes out
item.description: Shocking footage surfaced of an unnamed cop kneeling on the neck of Yugeshwar Gaindarpersaud, 31, during an arrest in Schenectady Monday.

item.title: Jair Bolsonaro has coronavirus
item.description: Bolsonaro, who has repeatedly played down the severity of the virus and mingled with crowds of supporters, said in a TV interview that his fourth coronavirus test had come back positive.

item.title: Married woman, 32, tricked lover, 18 with baby scans off eBay
item.description: Mother-of-three Sarah Dowson, 32, from Basingstoke, Hampshire, sent the deceiving scan pictures to the boy's mother, who subsequently helped raise the child as her grandson.

item.title: Workers tested for Covid-19 by their employers will have to pay tax on it
item.description: Under HM Revenue and Customs guidance, coronavirus tests are 'a taxable benefit in kind'. In the House of Commons today, Rishi Sunak said he 'will look into it very quickly'.

item.title: Fewer than one in seven people in UK are now smokers
item.description: A study by the Office for National Statistics (ONS) found that 6.9 million people in the UK, 14.1 per cent of the population over 18, smoked cigarettes last year, down from 14.7 in 2018.

item.title: Former lorry driver, 82, is confronted by paedophile hunters
item.description: Joseph Lennard, 82, bragged that he had imported illegal immigrants into the UK during his career and claimed he had engaged in sex acts with children.

item.title: Paris Jackson opens up about her struggles with self image and how she'd 'cut and burn' herself
item.description: In a new installment of her Facebook Watch series, Paris, 22, talks about her struggles with self image and harming herself during her lowest points suffering from depression.

item.title: Chrissie Hynde says she saw police stop athlete Bianca Williams
item.description: Team GB athlete Bianca Williams and her partner, Portuguese 400 metre runner Ricardo dos Santos, were stopped by police in Maida Vale, west London on Saturday.

item.title: British officials WILL consider telling people to wear face coverings in public, Matt Hancock says
item.description: In the House of Commons in London today, Mr Hancock said he would also consider creating badges for people to wear if they had a condition which meant they don't have to wear a mask.

item.title: Independent SAGE urges ministers to eliminate coronavirus in UK
item.description: Scientists led by the former chief scientific officer for England, Sir David King, accused the Government of 'giving up' on trying to stamp out the coronavirus in Britain and said it must keep going.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell is being held in a hell hole Brooklyn jail
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is now being held at Brooklyn's Metropolitan Detention Center - once described by a judge as 'like a third-world country' - after being arrested on child sex trafficking charges.

item.title: Johnny Depp credits Sir Elton John for helping him in his sobriety battle
item.description: The 57-year-old actor's libel case against his estranged wife, 34, got off to an explosive start on its first day in court on Tuesday, when his 2012 email to the Rocketman hitmaker was revealed.

item.title: Michel Barnier hints EU could compromise on Brexit fishing rights
item.description: Michel Barnier has hinted the EU is prepared to compromise on the crunch issue of fishing rights as he and his UK counterpart David Frost meet in Downing Street for Brexit trade talks this evening.

item.title: Grandfather, 82, takes over old airfield and turns it into international airport in West Wales
item.description: Winston Thomas, 82,A grandfather has turned an old airfield he owns in Prembrey, WestWales into an international standard airport, with Ryanair believed to be looking into landing flights there.

item.title: Top medical expert warns that thousands of Americans who survived COVID-19 are a ticking time bomb
item.description: Dr. Sassan Rafi says that COVID-19 patients diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis after weeks on a ventilator face a shocking morbidity rate.

item.title: Towns where buyers would benefit most from a stamp duty cut revealed
item.description: The biggest potential stamp duty savings in and outside of London have been revealed by property website Rightmove.

item.title: Harrowing video shows 'abducte'd British teenager being bundled into a car in Libya
item.description: The dramatic footage shows the teenager screaming for help before being shoved into the passenger seat of a battered Mercedes as her mother, from Wiltshire, pleaded for mercy.

item.title: Comet Neowise will be visible in the sky above UK this month
item.description: Formally named C/2020 F3 , the comet was discovered by the NEOWISE space telescope on March 27 and will reach its closest point to Earth on July 23.

item.title: Next and Asos drop Boohoo clothes from websites as £1bn is wiped off fast fashion firm's values
item.description: The Health and Safety Executive is probing three Leicester factories over claims staff are being forced to work with inadequate protection from coronavirus.

item.title: China warns the UK 'had better ask its people if they agree to let 3million Hong Kong people in'
item.description: The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs called on No. 10 to 'think twice' before making a final call to help up to three million British National Overseas (BNO) passport holders relocate from Hong Kong.

item.title: Deutsche Bank fined $150m over Jeffrey Epstein payments
item.description: New York's superintendent of financial services Linda Lacewell brought the fine this week as Epstein's long-time 'partner', Ghislaine Maxwell, was arrested on child sex trafficking charges.

item.title: Manchester bombing: Survivors demand core participant status
item.description: Lawyers are bidding to overturn a decision made by inquiry chairman Sir John Saunders not to grant the survivors core participant status at the hearing due to start in Manchester in September.

item.title: Number of deaths falls below average for SECOND week in a row
item.description: Department of Health data shows 95 Brits are now dying of the coronavirus each day, with the seven-day average in double figures for four days in a row after peaking at 945 in mid-April.

item.title: Ministers vow to 'stand up for British values and security' amid China row
item.description: The government is set to U-turn on allowing Huawei a role in the 5G project after intelligence agencies warned US sanctions had raised doubts about security.

item.title: Samsung's Note 20 Ultra may have leaked in first real-life images
item.description: There appear to be only a couple design changes compared to the Note 10, including the placement of the side volume and power buttons - both of which are on the right side of the device.

item.title: Volcanic island in Pacific Ocean is having 'growth spurt'
item.description: The Pacific volcanic island Nishinoshima is experiencing a 'vigorous growth spurt.' Experts observed multiple eruptions since June, which have added to its land mass.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: South West will be hardest hit by second wave
item.description: South West England fared well during the first bout of Covid-19. But now scientists fear the rural region is likely to be the first to endure the inevitable effects of the lockdown being eased.

item.title: Man builds 16ft wooden dinghy and removes door to get it out
item.description: Steve Goodchild, a retired land surveyor from Paignton, Devon, said he had built the boat over three months during lockdown. It will take to the water on its maiden voyage on Saturday.

item.title: One in seven could be jobless if the UK suffers second coronavirus peak -OECD
item.description: The OECD warned that the UK's unemployment rate is likely to hit 11.7 per cent by the end of the year as the world economy struggles to recover from lockdown.

item.title: Female teacher jailed for nine months for grooming pupil, 15
item.description: Drama teacher Kim Connor, 46, began grooming the youngster at a time when the victim was just 13 and struggling to come to terms with her sexuality.

item.title: Woman, 61, rescued after 22 YEARS 'as slave' at Brazil mansion
item.description: The woman rescued by labour authorities in a wealthy area of Sao Paulo last month had worked for the same family since 1998 without a single day's holiday.

item.title: Will Jessica Mulroney STILL back Meghan Markle in 'trial of the century'?
item.description: Ms Mulroney has been named by the Daily Telegraph in the UK and the E entertainment website in the US as one of the Duchess of Sussex's five friends who briefed People magazine.

item.title: Girl, 2, raped in coronavirus isolation ward in South Africa
item.description: The child was sexually abused while in isolation at the Dr George Mukhari Academic Hospital in Pretoria, it has been claimed.

item.title: Only 14 FTSE 100 firms have raised dividends for each of the last 10 years
item.description: Predicted dividend payouts for this year have also fallen by almost a third over that period from £91billion to £62billion, according to analysis from investment platform AJ Bell.

item.title: Britain's vast road network puts pipits and lapwings at risk
item.description: The UK's complex and dense road network is helping common birds to thrive, but is having a disastrous impact on some of Britain's most loved species.

item.title: We Can Work It Out? Original Beatles drummer Pete Best extends olive branch to replacement Ringo
item.description: Pete Best has reached out a hand of friendship to Sir Ringo Starr 58 years after he was sacked from The Beatles. Best said he thought 'why not' before sending a message, which has been praised by fans

item.title: Hong Kong police are handed power to raid people's homes without a warrant
item.description: Hong Kong police officers now also have the right to ban suspects from leaving the city, confiscate their assets, conduct secret surveillance and intercept communications, according to the law.

item.title: Ineos set to SCRAP plans to build its new Grenadier 4X4 in Britain
item.description: A new factory was due to be built in Bridgend, South Wales (inset left), for production of the utilitarian Grenadier 4X4, creating up to 500 jobs in the region. However, these plans could now be axed.

item.title: China furious at 'conspiracy theories' after dossier's spy claims
item.description: The bombshell 86-page report sparked a furious row by alleging a campaign by Beijing to persuade influential individuals to back Huawei and its strategic aims.

item.title: Aldi will not sell chlorinated chicken or hormone-treated beef even if UK strikes trade deal with US
item.description: Giles Hurley, chief executive of Aldi UK, has promised that his supermarket will only stock fresh chicken and beef supplied by British farmers.

item.title: Statins slash the risk of early death by 25 per cent, research claims
item.description: US experts found that people 75 years or older who were prescribed statins had a 25 percent lower risk of death than their counterparts.

item.title: Grenfell Tower inquiry is urged to be 'on the right side of history' and not 'ignore' race
item.description: The Grenfell Next of Kin group has called for an inquiry to investigate the extent to which institutional racism was a factor in the tragedy of June 2017. Four of 75 victims were visitors.

item.title: H&M announces plans to axe 170 stores across Europe this year after sales are hit by coronavirus
item.description: Two in five of the entire workforce employed by DHL on the JLR logistics contract face losing their jobs, according to trade union Unite - just hours after H&M said dozens of stores are shutting.

item.title: The Secrets She Keeps on BBC1 has viewers hooked
item.description: SPOILER ALERT. Inspired by a real-life story, BBC's The Secrets She Keeps, set in Australia, tells the story of two pregnant women who share the same due date but have very different lives.

item.title: Two killed in another explosion in Iran: Tehran blames 'Human error' for factory blast
item.description: The explosion rocked the Sepahan Boresh factory in the city of Baqershahr, south of Tehran, in the early hours of Tuesday morning, according to state media.

item.title: Thandie Newton reveals Tom Cruise left her 'terrified and insecure'
item.description: The British actress, 47, played Tom's character Ethan Hunt's love interest Nyah Nordoff‑Hall in the movie two decades ago

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall vows to break 'taboo' over discussing domestic abuse
item.description: In a pre-recorded discussion for the Women Of The World (Wow) online festival, Camilla, 72, said she wanted to 'lift the shroud of silence' when it comes to discussing domestic abuse.

item.title: Paramedics stabbed in chest starred in Inside The Ambulance
item.description: Deena Evans and Mike Hipgrave were attending a 999 call at a property in Wolverhampton when they were attacked by a knifeman.

item.title: US trainee teachers 'see black children as more angry'
item.description: US researchers showed prospective teachers clips of young child actors performing different emotions - and asked them to identify the expressions that they saw.

item.title: Kate Middleton reveals Prince George is upset because Prince Louis is winning a competition
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, revealed her children are taking part in a sunflower growing contest at Anmer Hall, Norfolk, to see whose plant can grow the tallest.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Leicester's infection rate falls, lockdown stays
item.description: The Health Secretary announced in the House of Commons today that Leicester's local lockdown appears to be working and the Covid-19 infection rate has fallen from 135 cases per 100,000 people to 117.

item.title: Millionaire's row mansion in Sandbanks hits the market for £6.5million
item.description: Water Weeds, a large detached house which backs onto the entrance to Poole Harbour, is described as an ideal spot to watch luxury boats and yachts pass by.

item.title: Passenger plane 'dropped 18,300 feet as windscreen cracked'
item.description: The crew were forced carry out the drastic response after a windscreen cracked nearly half an hour after take-off. The aircraft successfully landed in Chongqing just past midnight.

item.title: It will be DECADES before reductions in greenhouse gas emissions show
item.description: Experts from the CICERO Center for International Climate Research analysed how global warming will evolve under different assumptions on emission reductions.

item.title: Where to buy face masks in the UK: Best re-usable and surgical face coverings online
item.description: Wondering where to buy a face mask or face covering in the UK? Wearing face coverings in shops will also be mandatory from July 10 in Scotland.

item.title: Iraqi jihadism expert Hisham al-Hashemi killed
item.description: Footage showed a gunman firing through the window of Hisham al-Hashemi's car after pulling up on a motorcycle and ambushing him outside his home in the Iraqi capital.

item.title: US team set to take 'one last roll of the dice' at solving Annie McCarrick disappearance case
item.description: US lawyer Michael Griffith told The Herald his team have now identified 'one main suspect' in the case of Annie McCarrick, from New York, after uncovering a witness statement that was overlooked.

item.title: Prince Harry speaks about the 'challenges of digging deep to find resilience'
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 35, appeared to be speaking from the back garden of Tyler Perry's $18 million mansion in Los Angeles, where he has been living since stepping back from royal duty in March.

item.title: Man lashes out at an elderly woman who asked him to wear a mask in Florida Costco
item.description: In a shocking video taken at the scene, the man screams an expletive-laden tirade at the customer in the Gulf Coast Town Center store in Fort Myers, Florida.

item.title: Boys are TWICE as likely as girls to be bullied about their sexual orientation, study finds
item.description: Researchers from Brazil's national cancer institute studied health survey data submitted by 101,646 students in the country aged between 13 and 15.

item.title: UN slams Donald Trump for killing Iranian General Soleimani in drone strike
item.description: The January U.S. drone strike in Iraq that killed top Iranian general Qassem Soleimani and nine others represented a violation of international law, a U.N. human rights investigator said on Monday.

item.title: Police shut two pubs for ignoring social distancing rules after three closed over Covid fears
item.description: Durham Constabulary temporarily closed the Number One Bar in Darlington (pictured) when officers decided staff were not in control of how customers were behaving.

item.title: Woman embraces a 1940s wartime style after being inspired by her grandmother
item.description: Vintage obsessed Katie Morrison, 35, from Nuneaton, Warwickshire, copies outfits worn by her grandmother, Kathleen, in the 1940s by altering existing pieces and buying original vintage items.

item.title: Photos of abandoned Yorkshire house untouched since 2003
item.description: These are the chilling images which show a house lost in time, overgrown with dust and grime having been abandoned for almost 20 years in Hirst Courtney, north Yorkshire.

item.title: White House hunts for leaker of Russian bounties scandal
item.description: White House officials are on the hunt for the person or persons who leaked the intelligence about the Russian bounties on U.S. troops in Afghanistan to The New York Times.

item.title: WHO says it is 'carefully monitoring' bubonic plague outbreak in China
item.description: Authorities in the northern Chinese region of Inner Mongolia issued an early epidemic warning at the weekend after a herdsman caught bubonic plague, known as the 'Black Death' in the Middle Ages.

item.title: 'Green Homes' plan, stamp duty cut: What's in the mini budget?
item.description: Dubbed the 'mini budget', the coronavirus recovery package may pave the way for more significant changes to be announced in the official Autumn Budget later this year.

item.title: Foxes are piled high after being dragged from cramped cages in Asia
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC Thousands of foxes, some still alive, were tossed into piles after they were skinned for their fur, aerial footage taken by Humane Society International has revealed.

item.title: PIERS MORGAN on Prince Harry lecturing the world on inequality
item.description: There's something quite breathtakingly unedifying about the very rich deeply privileged Duke and Duchess banging on about equality from their $20 million borrowed mansion in Hollywood.

item.title: Transgender Vogue writer raises issue of abuse of LGBT teens
item.description: Transgender journalist Paris Lees said that the current debate about transgender people using public toilets should also consider how vulnerable LGBT teenagers are often abused in those spaces.

item.title: Cold temperatures in winter WILL increase the spread of COVID-19, research confirms
item.description: Researchers from India explored the relationship between a country's monthly average temperature and the number of COVID-19 cases.

item.title: Statue of British colonial explorer Francis Light is vandalised in Malaysia
item.description: The monument in George Town, the capital of the former British possession of Penang in Malaysia, is the latest symbol of imperialism to come under attack amid global anti-racism protests.

item.title: Dubai opens for tourists amid pandemic hoping to coax visitors back to beaches and shopping malls
item.description: Dubai is trumpeting the fact that it has reopened for tourism today. But what that means for this sheikhdom that relies on money spent by travellers remains in question.

item.title: Husband who set up multi-million company with wife criticised for 'rudely interrupting' her
item.description: Andrew Montague, Edinburgh, who founded a multi-million pound hand sanitiser company with his wife Rachel has been criticised for 'not letting her speak' during a This Morning interview.

item.title: Mike Tindall says daughter Mia has been 'so happy' and says reuniting with his parents was 'great'
item.description: Mike Tindall, 41, who spent lockdown in Gloucestershire with wife Zara, 39, and their children Mia, six, and Lena, two, told Hello! magazine that he recently reunited with his parents.

item.title: Mother diagnosed with terminal cancer is crowd-funding to get a dog for her children
item.description: Mother-of-two Beth Pitt-Roche, from St Edmunds, Suffolk, was told she had terminal cancer after the disease spread to her lungs, liver, spine and hips She is raising funds to get her children a dog.

item.title: Prince Harry looked 'awkward' during video call
item.description: Prince Harry looked 'awkward' and 'trapped' during the video call in which he called on the Commonwealth to 'acknowledge' its past wrongs, a body language expert has revealed.

item.title: There is no such thing as 'he's just not my type', scientists say
item.description: US researchers say they've found little evidence that people actually desire romantic partners who uniquely fit their ideal description.

item.title: Sheepadoodle presses buttons on a sound board to shout commands like 'play' 'beach' and 'park'
item.description: An amazing video shows him pressing different buttons to ask to play, go out and even tell owner Alexis Devine, from Tacoma, Washington, that he loves her.

item.title: Interview with mother who died of cancer after Covid stopped treatment leaves viewers 'in tears'
item.description: In Panorama: Britain's Cancer Crisis, which aired on Monday, mother-of-one Kelly Smith, 31, from Macclesfield, is seen telling presenter Deborah James that she's 'terrified' of dying.

item.title: Stunning NASA image reveals a 'fluffy galaxy' 67 million light-years away from Earth
item.description: Galaxy is called NGC 2275 and is located in the constellation of Cancer. Fluffy galaxies, such as this one, are described as flocculent by astronomers.
item.media:credit: ESA/Hubble & NASA, J. Lee and th

item.title: BAME people are up to 'FOUR TIMES more likely to have Covid-19'
item.description: A government-run Covid-19 surveillance scheme, which tested 36,000 people across England, revealed 4.5 per cent of white people had developed antibodies.

item.title: House prices see longest run of monthly falls in a decade, says Halifax
item.description: Mortgage lender Halifax said that the average house price dipped 0.1 per cent between May and June to £237,616 - first full month that England's estate agents were open for business.

item.title: Melbourne goes back into lockdown
item.description: Thirteen new cases are linked to nine Melbourne tower blocks which have suffered 69 cases and been placed under hard lockdown since Saturday.
item.media:credit: Matrix News for Daily Mail Australia

item.title: Junior doctor, 28, who was suspended for dodging travel fares can return to work
item.description: Dr Sharifa Scerif, 28, had exploited the taxpayer funded Freedom Pass system on 80 different occasions to dodge fares, but has now been given the all clear to go back to work.

item.title: Driver struggles to reverse jet ski trailer down a boat ramp leaving onlookers in fits of laughter
item.description: A black pickup truck tried and failed multiple times to reverse its jet ski trailer down a ramp at Canyon Lake in Texas. Onlookers laughed hysterically as the trailer jackknifed more than once on the descent.

item.title: NHS worker slammed for skipping supermarket queues despite showing her priority badge
item.description: An anonymous woman, who works for the NHS, asked users of UK online forum Mumsnet whether those working on the frontline should be allowed to continue to skip supermarket queues.

item.title: Pictured: Bus driver left brain dead after being punched in mask row
item.description: Philippe Monguillot (pictured with his wife Veronique) was dragged from the driver's seat and beaten by the gang of fare-dodgers as he tried to enforce coronavirus rules in Bayonne.

item.title: How to fold a fitted sheet in SECONDS: Mum wows the internet with her 'game-changing' method
item.description: A mother has wowed the internet with her simple four-step method for folding a fitted sheet in seconds - with many dubbing it a 'game changer'.

item.title: Former Miss Colombia shows off dance moves after amputating her left foot and part of her left leg
item.description: More than 2.6 million views have been generated by a video shared on Instagram on Sunday that shows former Miss Colombia Daniella Álvarez dancing after undergoing an amputation.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard lawyers seek to avoid confrontation
item.description: Lawyers for the warring former couple have been working to make sure they arrive at the High Court at separate times for the showdown to ensure there is no risk of them bumping into one another outside.

item.title: Amber Heard posts carefree snap ahead of face-to-face court battle with Johnny Depp
item.description: The actress, 34, looked relaxed and confident as she reclined on a picnic rug holding a book, soaking up the sunshine. Depp, 57, had tried to have her barred from his libel action.

item.title: Johnny Depp fails to have his ex Amber Heard banned from court while he gives evidence
item.description: Johnny Depp's legal team tried to exclude Heard from attending court until she was called by NGN as a witness - meaning she would be prevented from watching her ex-husband give evidence.
